nodes.description: Taliban suicide bomber detonated a massive car bomb outside a National Directorate for Security (NDS) camp in Ghazni city at 05:30 a.m. local time.
nodes.support_text: At 05:30 a.m. local time, a Taliban suicide bomber detonated a massive car bomb roughly at 05:30 a.m. local time outside a National Directorate for Security (NDS) camp in a southern area of Ghazni city, enabling the second group of militants to engage with security force members before trying to enter the station, a security source told Xinhua.

nodes.description: The explosion killed at least seven people and wounded 25 others, who were admitted to the provincial hospital in Ghazni city.
nodes.support_text: At least seven people were killed and 25 others wounded in a Taliban car bomb blast and an ensuing gun shooting outside an intelligence agency military camp in Afghanistan's eastern Ghazni province on Monday, a provincial source said. "Seven killed and 25 wounded people were admitted to the provincial hospital in provincial capital Ghazni city after a terrorist attack Monday morning," Baz Mohammad Hemat, head of provincial public health department, told Xinhua.

nodes.description: A second group of militants engaged with security force members before trying to enter the station after the explosion.
nodes.support_text: The incident occurred when a Taliban suicide bomber detonated a massive car bomb roughly at 05:30 a.m. local time outside a National Directorate for Security (NDS) camp in a southern area of Ghazni city, enabling the second group of militants to engage with security force members before trying to enter the station, a security source told Xinhua.

nodes.description: Sporadic clashes between attackers and security forces continued as of 08:00 a.m. local time in the area.
nodes.support_text: Sporadic clashes between attackers and security forces are still continuing as of 08:00 a.m. local time in the area.

nodes.description: Security forces cordoned off the area for precautionary measures.
nodes.support_text: Security forces have cordoned off the area for precautionary measures.

nodes.description: Thick gray smoke was seen rising above the site.
nodes.support_text: Thick gray smoke was seen rising above the site.

edges.support_text: The incident occurred when a Taliban suicide bomber detonated a massive car bomb roughly at 05:30 a.m. local time outside a National Directorate for Security (NDS) camp in a southern area of Ghazni city, enabling the second group of militants to engage with security force members before trying to enter the station, a security source told Xinhua.

The incident occurred when a Taliban suicide bomber detonated a massive car bomb roughly at 05:30 a.m. local time outside a National Directorate for Security (NDS) camp in a southern area of Ghazni city, enabling the second group of militants to engage with security force members before trying to enter the station, a security source told Xinhua.
Sporadic clashes between attackers and security forces are still continuing as of 08:00 a.m. local time in the area.
Security forces have cordoned off the area for precautionary measures.
Thick gray smoke was seen rising above the site.
